Class Cube

  • java.lang.Object
    • Cube

  • public class Cube
extends java.lang.Object
    Copyright 2017, Shoumyo Chakravorti, All rights reserved.

    Licensed under the MIT License.

    The Cube class defines the construction, turning, scrambling, and painting of the cube, as well as generation of a valid solution.

    Version:
    2.0
    Author:
    Shoumyo Chakravorti

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Cube()
      Constructs the Cube object by instantiating a Cubie for each position in three-dimensional space When the cube is held with Yellow facing up and Green facing front, x increases going from left to right, y increases going from the front to the back, and z increases going from the top to the bottom.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cornerInserted(int x, int y, int z)
      Correctly checks whether the corner at (2, 0, 2) is solved.
      java.lang.String finishWhiteLayer()
      Completes the white layer by inserting any white corners in the U layer and fixing misoriented white corners until there are no more white corners in the U layer.
      char[][][] getColors()
      This method allows for the painting of the cube in the GUI.
      java.lang.String insertAllEdges()
      Utilizes the methods insertEdgesInU() and insertMisorientedEdges() to complete the second layer
      java.lang.String insertCornersInU()
      Inserts any white corners that are in the U layer.
      java.lang.String insertEdgesInU()
      Inserts all non-yellow edges in the U layer into their respective slots in the second layer using one of two algorithms
      java.lang.String insertMisorientedCorners()
      Properly inserts white corners that are in the first layer but not oriented correctly
      java.lang.String insertMisorientedEdges()
      If there are any edges in the second layer that were inserted in the incorrect orientation, this method re-inserts them in the correct orientation
      java.lang.String makeSunflower()
      Makes the sunflower (yellow center in the middle with 4 white edges surrounding it).
      java.lang.String makeWhiteCross()
      Once the sunflower is made, this method matches white edges to their respective faces and turns them down one at a time, creating the white cross.
      java.lang.String makeYellowCross()
      Orients all yellow edges in the U layer based on their current state.

      Checks whether any non-yellow edges remain in the U layer.

      Optimizes the moves inputed by reducing redundant and unnecessary turns or rotations.
      java.lang.String orientLastLayer()
      Finishes the step of orienting the last layer by orienting all yellow corners using a beginner's method algorithm.

      Paints the cube using methods from the AWT framework.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Cube

        public Cube()
        Constructs the Cube object by instantiating a Cubie for each position in three-dimensional space When the cube is held with Yellow facing up and Green facing front, x increases going from left to right, y increases going from the front to the back, and z increases going from the top to the bottom. x, y, and z are zero-indexed. The core of the cube is not an actual cubie, but is instantiated as one to prevent runtime error

    • Method Detail

      • turn

        public void turn(java.lang.String turn)
        Takes a String value of a turn or rotation in standard Rubik's Cube notation and applies the turn or rotation to the cube. Valid turns currently include any turn in the following planes: U, D, F, B, L, R, M, E, S Valid rotations are x, y, and z rotations.
        Parameters:
        turn - the turn to be performed

      • performMoves

        public java.lang.String performMoves(java.lang.String moves)
        Loops through the characters in a String of standard turning notation to apply the set of moves to the cube Checks for clockwise, double, and counterclockwise turns
        Parameters:
        moves - the moves to be applied to the cube
        Returns:
        the moves performed on the cube (same as moves)

      • reverseMoves

        public void reverseMoves(java.lang.String moves)
        Performs the inverse of the moves inputed as parameters. For example, if the parameter is "U' ", the moves "U" will be applied upon the cube to negate the "U' ". Helper method for use in the CubePainter class to rewind moves.
        Parameters:
        moves - the moves to be reversed

      • optimizeMoves

        public java.lang.String optimizeMoves(java.lang.String moves)
        Optimizes the moves inputed by reducing redundant and unnecessary turns or rotations. For example, "U U'" would be negated; "U U2" is simplified to "U'"; and "U U" is simplified to "U2".
        Parameters:
        moves - the String of moves to be optimized
        Returns:
        the optimized set of moves

      • randScramble

        public java.lang.String randScramble()
        Generates a random scramble. \n NOTE: the scramble generated is a random move scramble, not a random state scramble. A random state scramble is generated by assembling the cube into a random state, solving the cube, and taking the reverse of the solution to display as a scramble. This method simply assembles a scramble out of the allowed set of face moves, ensuring that no move is the same as the two moves prior to it.
        Returns:
        a random scramble

      • scramble

        public void scramble(java.lang.String scramble)
        Scrambles a cube according to WCA rules (White on top, Green in front). After scrambling, returns the cube to the original position (Yellow on top, Green in front) form which a solution can be generated.
        Parameters:
        scramble - the scramble to be performed

      • makeWhiteCross

        public java.lang.String makeWhiteCross()
        Once the sunflower is made, this method matches white edges to their respective faces and turns them down one at a time, creating the white cross.
        Returns:
        the moves used to create the white cross

      • makeSunflower

        public java.lang.String makeSunflower()
        Makes the sunflower (yellow center in the middle with 4 white edges surrounding it). The sunflower can then be used by makeCross() to make the white cross
        Returns:
        moves used to make sunflower

      • prepareSlot

        public java.lang.String prepareSlot(int x,
                                    int y,
                                    int z,
                                    char color)
        Utility method for makeSunflower() Prepares a slot in the U face for white edges to be brought up into the U layer without misorienting white edges already in the U layer
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the cubie to prepare
        y - the y position
        z - the z position
        color - the color which should not remain in the prepared slot
        Returns:
        moves used to prepare the edge slot

      • numWhiteEdgesOriented

        public int numWhiteEdgesOriented()
        Utility method for makeSunflower()
        Returns:
        the number of white edges that are currently in the U layer

      • finishWhiteLayer

        public java.lang.String finishWhiteLayer()
        Completes the white layer by inserting any white corners in the U layer and fixing misoriented white corners until there are no more white corners in the U layer.
        Returns:
        the moves used to complete the white layer

      • whiteCornerinU

        public boolean whiteCornerinU()
        Utility method for insertCornersinU()
        Returns:
        if there are any white corners in the U layer

      • insertCornersInU

        public java.lang.String insertCornersInU()
        Inserts any white corners that are in the U layer. First positions them to the position (2, 0, 0), then makes U turns and y rotations until the white corner is above its respective slot, and finally inserts the corner by repetitively executing R U R' U'. This is repeated of all whit corners in the U layer.
        Returns:
        moves used to insert white corners that are in the U layer

      • insertMisorientedCorners

        public java.lang.String insertMisorientedCorners()
        Properly inserts white corners that are in the first layer but not oriented correctly
        Returns:
        moves used to properly orient misoriented white corners

      • whiteCornerPrepared

        public boolean whiteCornerPrepared()
        Utility method for insertCornersInU(). Checks for whether the corner cubie at (2, 0, 0) belongs in (2, 0, 2).
        Returns:
        true if cubie at (2, 0, 0) belongs in (2, 0, 2), else false

      • cornerInserted

        public boolean cornerInserted(int x,
                              int y,
                              int z)
        Correctly checks whether the corner at (2, 0, 2) is solved.
        Parameters:
        x - the position to check for (although this method is only called with (2, 0, 2).
        y - see above
        z - see above
        Returns:
        true if corner is solved, else false

      • insertAllEdges

        public java.lang.String insertAllEdges()
        Utilizes the methods insertEdgesInU() and insertMisorientedEdges() to complete the second layer
        Returns:
        A String for the moves used to complete the second layer

      • nonYellowEdgesInU

        public boolean nonYellowEdgesInU()
        Checks whether any non-yellow edges remain in the U layer. (Any such edges need to be inserted into their respective slot in the second layer)
        Returns:
        whether there is/are non-yellow edges in the U layer

      • insertEdgesInU

        public java.lang.String insertEdgesInU()
        Inserts all non-yellow edges in the U layer into their respective slots in the second layer using one of two algorithms
        Returns:
        moves used to insert non-yellow edges in the U layer

      • insertMisorientedEdges

        public java.lang.String insertMisorientedEdges()
        If there are any edges in the second layer that were inserted in the incorrect orientation, this method re-inserts them in the correct orientation
        Returns:
        moves used to fix edge orientations in second layer

      • numYellowEdgesOriented

        public int numYellowEdgesOriented()
        Utility method for yellowEdgeOrientation() and makeYellowCross()
        Returns:
        the number of yellow edges that are already oriented in the U layer

      • numYellowCornersOriented

        public int numYellowCornersOriented()
        Utility method for orientLastLayer()
        Returns:
        the number of yellow corners that are already oriented in the U layer

      • yellowEdgeOrientation

        public java.lang.String yellowEdgeOrientation()
        Utility method for makeYellowCross(). Determines the shape that the oriented yellow edges make.
        Returns:
        Dot, L, Bar, or Cross

      • makeYellowCross

        public java.lang.String makeYellowCross()
        Orients all yellow edges in the U layer based on their current state.
        Returns:
        moves used to make the yellow cross

      • orientLastLayer

        public java.lang.String orientLastLayer()
        Finishes the step of orienting the last layer by orienting all yellow corners using a beginner's method algorithm. (This has been left separate from makeYellowCross() to help beginners easily follow the steps to orient the last layer completely.)
        Returns:
        moves used to orient last layer pieces

      • permuteLastLayer

        public java.lang.String permuteLastLayer()
        Permutes the last layer such that all oriented pieces are in the correct positions relative to each other. First permutes the corners, then the edges.
        Returns:
        the moves used to permute the last layer

      • getColors

        public char[][][] getColors()
        This method allows for the painting of the cube in the GUI. All 6 faces' colors are stored in 2D arrays as character values, then all 2D arrays are inserted into a 3D array so that all faces' colors can be accessed in one method call instead of having to call 6 different methods. NOTE: This method was used prior to the paintComponent() method was implemented in this class.
        Returns:
        the set of all colors that define the state of the cube

      • setCubieColor

        public void setCubieColor(int x,
                          int y,
                          int z,
                          char dir,
                          char ncolor)
        Changes a single color of a cubie to a new color in the given direction
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the cubie
        y - y position
        z - z position
        dir - the direction
        ncolor - the new color

      • testTurning

        public void testTurning()
        Outputs the position, colors, and respective directions of colors of every cubie making up the cube. Used for debugging purposes prior to GUI development. Outputs in the format: x, y, z, color1, dir1, color2, dir2, color3, dir3 (number of colors and directions dependent on cubie type)

      • setAllColors

        public void setAllColors(char[][][] colors)
        Sets all the colors of the cube to the colors inputed by the user during color selection mode. Invoked from the CubePainter class when user decides to proceed to solution after inputing colors. The colors inputed as the colors[][][] parameter are in a slightly different state than the colors produced by the getColors() method. If the side is not the yellow or white side, then the user inputed the colors when yellow is above and white is below the desired face. If the face is the yellow face, the user inputed as if blue was above and green was below the yellow face, the blue and green being in the opposite orientation for when inputing colors on the white face.
        Parameters:
        colors - all colors to be put into the cube

      • paintComponent

        public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the cube using methods from the AWT framework. Paints the cube in an "unfolded" manner.
        Parameters:
        g - A Graphics object
